DOC.brief_summary: This study cross-sectional survey interobserver variability associate contrast enhance ultrasound ( CEUS ) detect endoleaks use computed tomographic angiography ( CTA ) practice standard . The investigator enroll 40 consecutive patient undergo endovascular abdominal aortic aneurysm repair ( EVAR ) . At first follow-up visit procedure , participant undergo two abdominal ultrasound examination without contrast , one CTA . Analyses conduct examine interobserver variability detection characterization endoleaks use contrast-enhanced ultrasound ( CEUS ) . Other endpoint include examination sensitivity specificity CEUS compare CTA , characterization number type endoleaks detect .
DOC.brief_title: Evaluation Contrast-Enhanced Ultrasound Detect Endoleaks After Endovascular Aortic Aneurysm Repair
DOC.criteria: 1 . Age 18 year age great ; 2 . Diagnosed abdominal aortic aneurysm undergone schedule undergo endovascular repair procedure . 3 . Has complete first schedule posttreatment followup exam 4 . Voluntary participation signature IRBapproved inform consent . 1 . Inability consent ( include nonEnglish speaking patient ) 2 . Has already complete first schedule posttreatment followup exam . 3 . Clinical instability ; 4 . Pregnancy / breast feeding ; 5 . Known allergy perflutren ; 6 . Known suspected righttoleft , bidirectional , transient righttoleft cardiac shunt ( base manufacturer recommendation use ) ; 7 . Recent heart attack ( < 6 month ) , unstable angina uncontrolled cardiopulmonary disease 8 . Clinically unstable recent worsen congestive heart failure ( base FDA warn ) 9 . Serious ventricular arrhythmia high risk arrhythmias 10 . Respiratory failure ( base FDA warn ) 11 . Severe emphysema , pulmonary embolus condition compromise pulmonary arterial vasculature ( base FDA warn ) 12 . Any reason judge investigator hamper inclusion .
